paragraphs.text: Our unkept promise to Afghan women.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: As international leaders gathered in London this week to discuss Afghanistan, we once again heard familiar proclamations of support for Afghanistan and renewed commitments towards its people, particularly women and girls
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: International partners promised to continue to assist Afghanistan through its "transformation decade", but also underlined that as NATO completes it military mission, they also expect the country to stand on its own feet
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This message has its merits
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: International donors have been generous in giving billions in foreign aid to Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Countless lives - foreigners and Afghans - have been lost in the violence
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: As the military transition completes, Afghanistan is also ushering in a new government, headed by President Ashraf Ghani
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who has visionary ambitions for his country, and has made firm commitments to support and empower women and girls
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As a regular visitor to the war-torn country, I, too, believe that Afghans possess the ingenuity, resilience and desire to transform from poverty to prosperity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There have been remarkable, often unacknowledged, gains in Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For years, as the Taliban ruled, Afghanistan was the world's forgotten country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Human rights abuses were endemic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the population shrank
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: millions poured over the borders to Iran and Pakistan as refugees
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Women were kept from schools and employment and forced into early marriages
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Today, many of those refugees have returned home
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Millions of girls are in school
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: record numbers of women are pursuing higher education
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There are accomplished female political leaders, policewomen, judges
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: for the first time in its young democracy, Afghanistan has a high-profile and active First Lady, Rula Ghani, championing the rights of Afghanistan's internally displaced
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Unfinished business
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as we acknowledge progress, we must also accept we have unfinished business in Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no quick fix for the devastation of 40 years of war
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Afghan people are still struggling
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As foreign troops prepare to leave
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: my organisation, the Norwegian Refugee Council, is expanding its humanitarian programmes to assist growing numbers of internally displaced persons
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2014 alone, 120,000 Afghans have fled their homes and communities because of violence
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: These displaced Afghans, often in need of urgent assistance, typically flock to Kabul and other cities where they believe support will be available for them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: walk around the overcrowded, ramshackle dwellings, as I did late last year
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is clear to see that their needs are not being met
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On the contrary
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they are growing, with women almost always suffering the most
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Afghan women I met told me how their priority is to find a safe place to live in a land still beleaguered by violence
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They spoke of the enormous challenges they faced for members of their families to find jobs or earn an adequate income in a country where more than a third already live under the poverty line
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many shared with me the worries they have about being able to put food on the table for their families
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: a concern all the more alarming given that 1.2 million of the country's children presently suffer from malnutrition
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Women without the support of male family members; those widowed, abandoned, who have escaped abuse or care for a disabled husband, are particularly vulnerable
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: As
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there can be no quick fix for war
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: there is no easy solution for decades of women's rights abuses
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Women are much more likely to be more disadvantaged than their husband or brother
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: many face extreme poverty, physical and psychological violence, illiteracy and discrimination in all facets of life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There are still deeply entrenched social stigmas towards women working or pursuing education
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Unaware of rights
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Many Afghan women are not aware of their rights
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: their voices are too rarely heard
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I am proud that the Norwegian Refugee Council works directly with thousands of women at a community level to educate them about their legal rights, and help them navigate systems and processes that still too often discriminate against them
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: despite these needs, despite the tenuous gains in women's rights, international humanitarian support to help Afghanistan is actually declining
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2014, the UN lowered its humanitarian appeal by 14 percent, in recognition that donors would not provide adequate funding for a larger appeal
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The US - by far the largest donor - halved its development aid in 2014
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In August, the World Food Programme announced that a $40m funding shortfall meant that they were forced to cut food rations
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: meaning food shortages are likely to grow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We hear all too often that girls' schools are facing closure because of lack of future funding
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In many respects, the realities in Afghanistan today have been an uneasy backdrop to the London Conference
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: international partners have again committed to support Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: this must be matched with donors making real, long-term contributions
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For Afghanistan to be the country of prosperity, freedom and safety we want it to be, and with full support for women's rights, international governments must produce a set of genuine commitments and pledges, including addressing the most pressing humanitarian needs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Ordinary Afghans, women in particular, must be reassured that "transformation" doesn't equate to a reduction in the world's interest or concern for their lives
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We have no excuses
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We know what needs to be done
paragraphs.label: assumption
